definition: nobody is perfect/everyone has their defect

sentences.english: Because nobody is perfect, and nobody deserves to be perfect.
sentences.chinese: 因爲世上無完人，每個人都不值得完美的眷顧。

sentences.english: The aim of modern education is to educate perfect man.
sentences.chinese: 現代社會的教育目的是培養完人。

sentences.english: He is the complete man, being the one who realized the most absurd condition.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個完人，因爲他實現了最爲荒謬的環境。

sentences.english: Remember that society elevates experts high onto a pedestal.
sentences.chinese: 記住社會總是把專家奉爲完人。

sentences.english: Each year one vicious habit rooted out, in time might make the worst man good throughout.
sentences.chinese: 每一年肅除一惡習，惡根亦會成完人。

definition: nobody is perfect/everyone has their defect
not all gold is sufficiently red (idiom); no-one is perfect
Heaven's law/the natural order of things
person who seeks advancement by any means/career climber/unscrupulous careerist
common sense/the way people usually feel about things
a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
to return good for evil (idiom)/to requite evil with good
